The claim is supported by statements and: which stated that "over the next two decades, nearly 80 million Americans will become eligible for Social Security benefits, more than 10,000 per day."
The claim is also backed by a press rele: which announced that the first baby boomer claimed early retirement benefits and mentioned that "over the next two decades, nearly 80 million Americans will become eligible for Social Security benefits, more than 10,000 per day."
The Pew Research Center: in a 2010 study on baby boomers, highlighted the statistic of 10,000 new seniors becoming eligible for entitlement programs per day, using Census data.
House Majority Leader Eric Cantor: s press secretary, Megan Whittemore, pointed to the statements and reports by the Social Security Administration as the source for Cantor's claim of 10,000 new seniors becoming eligible for entitlement programs each day.
